sections.text:
85-102.University of Nebraska; object.

The object of the University of Nebraska shall be to afford to the inhabitants of this state the means of acquiring a thorough knowledge of the various branches of literature, science and arts.

SourceLaws 1869, § 2, p. 172;R.S.1913, § 7082;C.S.1922, § 6714;C.S.1929, § 85-102;R.S.1943, § 85-102;Laws 2023, LB705, § 109.

Annotations

Affording the means of acquiring a thorough knowledge of the various branches of literature, science and the arts is not the limit of the purposes, powers or activities of the University of Nebraska. Fisher v. Board of Regents, 108 Neb. 666, 189 N.W. 161 (1922).
